properties.areaDesc: San Diego County Deserts; Coachella Valley
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 9:22PM PST until February 4 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 20 to 30 mph with
gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-
freezing temperatures as low as 28 possible.

* WHERE...Coachella Valley and San Diego County Deserts.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, through noon PST Monday. For
the Freeze Watch, from Monday evening through Tuesday morning
then again Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines.
Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially
for high profile vehicles along Interstate 10. Frost and freeze
conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and
possibly damage unprotected plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust could reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around
trees and branches. If possible, avoid windows. Use caution if
you must drive.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of water pipes they should be
wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-
ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-ground
pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
